required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Visual Performance Investigation of Two Toric Soft Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Visual Performance Investigation of Two Toric Soft Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the amount of coma as measured by aberrometry induced by two silicone hydrogel toric lenses in astigmatic participants.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ocular coma score at Day 30
primary_outcome.description: Ocular coma is a type of optical aberration or a distortion in image formation occurring when a bundle of light rays enters an optical system (eye) that is not parallel to the optic axis. Ocular coma will be measured in micrometers using a Ladarwave aberrometer. A lower number indicates less coma/less image distortion.

arm_group.description: Lotrafilcon B contact lenses worn in Period 1, followed by comfilcon A contact lenses in Period 2, as randomized. Each product will be worn bilaterally on a daily wear basis for 30 days, removed nightly. A minimum 1-day washout of no contact lens wear will precede each wear period.

Comfilcon A contact lenses worn in Period 1, followed by lotrafilcon B contact lenses in Period 2, as randomized. Each product will be worn bilaterally on a daily wear basis for 30 days, removed nightly. A minimum 1-day washout of no contact lens wear will precede each wear period.

intervention.description: Commercially available, silicone hydrogel contact lens for correction of astigmatism
Commercially available, silicone hydrogel contact lens for correction of astigmatism

overall_official.affiliation: School of Optometry and Vision Science

facility.name: School of Optometry and Vision Science
